sections.markdown:
# DQL Uses Cases & Best Practices
Este Notebook proporciona documentaci√≥n y casos de uso con DQL.

**Preguntas o feedback?**: [angelica.barranco@dynatrace.com](mailto:angelica.barranco@dynatrace.com?subject=Feedback%20on%20Grail)

Para obtener m√°s informaci√≥n sobre Dynatrace Query Language (DQL), vaya aqu√≠:
* [(Doc) Dynatrace Query Language (DQL)](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/dql-dynatrace-query-language-hub)
* [(Doc) DQL commands](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/dql-commands-overview)
* [(Video) A Practical Guide to DQL](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F2VbVqNlswk)
* [(APP) Learn DQL](https://wkf10640.apps.dynatrace.com/ui/apps/dynatrace.learndql/)

## Como inicio una query?

Una query puede SOLO puede iniciar con un Data source commands. Son **4**:
* `data` : Genera datos de muestra durante el tiempo de ejecuci√≥n de la consulta.
* `describe`: Describe el esquema de datos para un objeto de datos determinado.
* `fetch`: Carga datos del recurso especificado.
* `timeseries`: Combina cargar, filtrar y agregar datos de m√©tricas en una salida de time series.

# [`data`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#data)
> Genera datos de muestra durante el tiempo de ejecuci√≥n de la consulta.

üéØ Lista de tipos de datos ingestados en Dynatrace (spans, RUM, bizevents, sythectic). 
* Si esta disponible en Grail `storage.grail = true`.
* Si esta disponible en almacenamiento cl√°sico `storage.classic = true`.

input.value:
data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true, use=true),
     record(data = "spans", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true, use=true)
| fieldsAdd use2 = true
| fieldsRename data, data2

grail.canonicalQuery:
data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = TRUE), record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = TRUE, storage.classic = TRUE, use = TRUE), record(data = "spans", storage.grail = TRUE, storage.classic = TRUE, use = TRUE)
| fieldsAdd use2 = TRUE
| fieldsRename data2 = data
grail.query:
data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true, use=true),
     record(data = "spans", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true, use=true)
| fieldsAdd use2 = true
| fieldsRename data, data2

input.value:
data record(data = "logs", storage.grail = true),
     record(data = "DEM", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true, use=true),
     record(data = "spans", storage.grail = true, storage.classic=true, use=true)
| fieldsAdd use2 = true
| fieldsRename data, data2

sections.markdown:
# [`describe`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#describe)
> Describe el esquema de datos para un objeto de datos determinado.

üéØ Cuantas propiedades/fields conocidos tienen los `host` en este ambiente? Y listar por orden alfabetico.

*Hints:*
* Usar [Ordering commands](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/ordering-commands)

# [`fetch`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#fetch)
> Carga datos del recurso especificado.

üéØ Listar los host. Mostar solo `nombre`, `ip` y `tags`.

*Hints:*
* Usar el resultado de la query anterior.
* Usar [`Selection and modification commands`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/selection-and-modification-commands)

details.errorMessage: The end of the query isn't allowed here. Please check the autocomplete suggestions before the error for alternative options.
details.errorMessageFormat: %1$s isn't allowed here. Please check the autocomplete suggestions before the error for alternative options.

result.error: The end of the query isn't allowed here. Please check the autocomplete suggestions before the error for alternative options.

sections.markdown:
# [`timeseries`](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/data-source-commands#fetch)
> Cargar, filtrar y agregar datos de m√©tricas en una salida de time series.

üéØ Tiempo del tiempo de respuesta promedio (ms) del servicio con mayor cantidad de peticiones de las √∫ltimas 24h.

*Hints:*
* Usar [Array functions](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/array-functions)
* `dt.service.request.count` y `dt.service.request.response_time`

details.errorMessage: The end of the query isn't allowed here. Please check the autocomplete suggestions before the error for alternative options.

sections.markdown: ## Best Practices
# 1. Filtar al inicio.

>  ‚åõ El **rendimiento** general de las consultas mejora enormemente al reducir el conjunto de datos antes de continuar con el procesamiento. 

> üí∞ Segmentar la data para filtar por `dt.system.bucket`  y reducir el costo de la query.

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize by:{event.type, event.kind}, count = count()

input.value:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket =="default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize count = count(), by:{event.type}

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket == "default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize by:{event.type}, count = count()
grail.query:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket =="default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize count = count(), by:{event.type}

input.value:
fetch events
| filter dt.system.bucket =="default_synthetic_events"
| filter event.kind == "SYNTHETIC_EVENT"
| summarize count = count(), by:{event.type}

sections.markdown: # 2. Reducir el rango de tiempo de consulta (si aplica)
> ‚åõüí∞ De esta forma se escanea menos data y reduce el costo de la query.

# 3. Nombres de campos que se deben evitar
* true
* false
* null
* mod
* and
* or
* xor
* not

## 4. Usar m√©tricas
> üí∞ Si la data ya esta ingestada como m√©trica, usala.

> üí∞ Si utilizas comandos `summarize` o `makeTimeseries` crea m√©tricas a a partir de logs, events, etc.
## 5. Utilizar opciones para limitar la cantidad de datos escaneados (Logs | Spans‚ö†Ô∏è)

input.value:
fetch spans

// only spans which contain a span event of type "exception"
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events | fields span.events | fieldsFlatten span.events | fieldsRemove span.events

| summarize count = count(), by:{ span.events.exception.message}
| sort count desc
| limit 10

Sorry, we cannot process American Express credit cards. Only Visa or Mastercard are accepted.
Credit card info is invalid
failed to charge card: could not charge the card: rpc error: code = Code(400) desc = Credit card info is invalid

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch spans
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events
| fields span.events
| fieldsFlatten span.events
| fieldsRemove span.events
| summarize by:{span.events.exception.message}, count = count()
| sort count desc
| limit 10
grail.query:
fetch spans

// only spans which contain a span event of type "exception"
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events | fields span.events | fieldsFlatten span.events | fieldsRemove span.events

| summarize count = count(), by:{ span.events.exception.message}
| sort count desc
| limit 10

input.value:
fetch spans

// only spans which contain a span event of type "exception"
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events | fields span.events | fieldsFlatten span.events | fieldsRemove span.events

| summarize count = count(), by:{ span.events.exception.message}
| sort count desc
| limit 10

fetch spans, scanLimitGBytes:1

// only spans which contain a span event of type "exception"
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events | fields span.events | fieldsFlatten span.events | fieldsRemove span.events

| summarize count = count(), by:{ span.events.exception.message}
| sort count desc
| limit 10

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch spans, scanLimitGBytes:1
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events
| fields span.events
| fieldsFlatten span.events
| fieldsRemove span.events
| summarize by:{span.events.exception.message}, count = count()
| sort count desc
| limit 10
grail.query:
fetch spans, scanLimitGBytes:1

// only spans which contain a span event of type "exception"
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events | fields span.events | fieldsFlatten span.events | fieldsRemove span.events

| summarize count = count(), by:{ span.events.exception.message}
| sort count desc
| limit 10

input.value:
fetch spans, scanLimitGBytes:1

// only spans which contain a span event of type "exception"
| filter iAny(span.events[][span_event.name] == "exception")
| expand span.events | fields span.events | fieldsFlatten span.events | fieldsRemove span.events

| summarize count = count(), by:{ span.events.exception.message}
| sort count desc
| limit 10

sections.markdown:
## 6. Utilizar las opciones de muestreo disponibles (Logs | Spans‚ö†Ô∏è)
Los rangos de valores aplicables para el muestreo son:

* 1: Default value (no sampling).
* 10
* 100
* 1000
* 10000:

input.value:
fetch logs, from:-1d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR"), by:bin(timestamp, 3h)

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch logs, from:-1d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize by:{bin(timestamp, 3h)}, c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR")
grail.query:
fetch logs, from:-1d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR"), by:bin(timestamp, 3h)

notifications.messageFormat: The parameters should be grouped with curly braces: {}.
notifications.message: The parameters should be grouped with curly braces: {}.

notifications.message: The parameters should be grouped with curly braces: {}.

input.value:
fetch logs, from:-1d, samplingRatio:100
| summarize c = countIf(loglevel == "ERROR"), by:bin(timestamp, 3h)
